data.name: Cash Management Account
data.description: The BT Cash Management Account (BT CMA) is an at call transaction account designed to allow customers the flexibility of accessing their funds at any time while offering a standard variable base rate interest. The BT CMA is the default 'transaction account' for the Panorama Investments and the BT Invest Account (Panorama Investments Account). The BT CMA is used to settle managed fund and equity trades, as well as facilitate transactions and consequent cash movements including the receipt of deposits and payment of fees.

features.additionalInfo: No minimum balance, but you may be required to maintain a minimum balance in your BT CMA to meet the Panorama Investment Account.
No additional BT CMA transaction or administration fees.
Ability to access the BT CMA through Panorama Online and the Panorama Mobile Application.
Ability to use BPAY to transfer money into the BT CMA Saver or make payments
Ability to setup a direct debit to transfer money from a Linked Account to the BT CMA Saver
The product includes fraud protection features.

eligibility.additionalInfo:
If you are outside Australia, you should obtain advice about any local restrictions that apply before investing in the BT CMA and you must appoint an Australian resident
attorney to act on your behalf.
The BT CMA is only available to investors who receive these Terms and Conditions in Australia, whether in hard copy or electronically.

fees.name: Transaction Fees
fees.additionalInfo: Current as at 4 October 2019, Advice fees may apply. Interest rates are subject to change. There are currently no fees or charges applicable to the BT Cash Management Account Saver. Fees and charges may apply for the Panorama platform and term deposits.
